Course Title: Ore Reserve Risk and Mine Planning.
Semester: Fac Partner & Summer Studies (School of Continuing Studies)
Description: Methods to build up to the presentation of a new generation of applied technologies (stochastic mine planning optimization) dealing with geological risk and its substantial effects on ore reserves; strategic planning; optimization; risk management and profitability.

Semester: Fac Partner & Summer Studies (School of Continuing Studies)
Description: Regulatory mechanisms of international organizations (IOs) and their impact on global governance; challenges of global policy-making; regulatory mechanisms for overcoming these challenges; growing role of non-state actors (civil society groups and business leaders) in global policy-making; analysis of governance of the use of force; other international governance issues; climate change negotiation simulation.

Course Title: Diving into the Research Pool: A Professional Development Workshop for Graduate Students.
Description: Get the information you need. Gather useful tips on how to broaden and refine your research topic in this hands-on session. Move from known sources of information to less obvious avenues; to find relevant information for your research.   Part of the MyResearch graduate seminar series; a collaborative offering of McGill Libraries; Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies; and Teaching and Learning Services.

Course Title: Going Deeper: A Professional Development Workshop for Graduate Students.
Description: Refine your search. Reach an advanced level in resource discovery in this hands-on session. Understand discipline-specific resources and how to access specific types of information resources; to give you the edge in your research.   Part of the MyResearch graduate seminar series; a collaborative offering of McGill Libraries; Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies; and Teaching and Learning Services.

Description: Learning to Teach: A Professional Development Workshop for Graduate Students at McGill.

Course Title: Learning to Teach: A Professional Development Workshop for Graduate Students.
Learning to Teach: A Professional Development Workshop for Graduate Students.

Description: In this interactive workshop; we will help you discover the difference between a program of research versus a project; and identify the realities of grant writing; including: how to assess your preparedness to apply; creating a timeline for developing a proposal; tips on how to make it more competitive; and components of an effective budget.

Offered By: Artificial Course (not GDEU) (Not used in standing)
